commitResults.messageTitle: Initialize: Create skeletal code for Beefy.java
Style: Create Main class and add empty line at end of Beefy.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Beefy.java is the entry point.

Creating a Main class to be used as the entry point for our program is
cleaner and follows the coding standards.

Let's
* Create a new class Main
* Create class functions in Beefy e.g printSeparation(), startChat(),
endChat() to be used in Main class

commitResults.messageTitle: Feature: Add echo user command
Feature: Add add and list functionality
Feature: Add ability to mark and unmark tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
All text typed by user is stored in Beefy class.

Creating two new classes to execute the tasks of storing information of
the task and storage of all tasks created will make the code easier
to understand.

Let's
* Create a Task class to store information of each individual task
* Create a TaskList class to compile and store all tasks that have been
created

commitResults.messageTitle: Style: Shift creation of Task variable to addTask function
commitResults.messageBody:
Task is created in startChat() function.

Shifting the creation of Task variable from startChat function in
Beefy class to the addTask function in TaskList class, will follow the
proper coding standards.

Let's change the function addTask in TaskList to accept the task
description and create the Task variable in it.

commitResults.messageTitle: Style: Change constant name from BOTNAME to BOT_NAME
Feature: Add ToDos, Events and Deadline functionalities
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's
* Define an enum type, CommandType, to help determine which command
should be executed
* Create 3 new children classes of Task (ToDo, Deadline, Event) to
allow for differentiation between the types of task to add to
TaskList
* Create a function, executeCommand, to receive user's input and
command type so as to determine which command to execute

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code: Change executeCommand + Add space for task printing
commitResults.messageBody:
executeCommand function does not handle cases where user input is
formatted incorrectly for the adding of Tasks.

Checking for above mentioned cases would prevent the code from
exiting with error.

Let's add try and catch statements to print the proper format to use
for users to view, upon detection of improper formatting.

commitResults.messageTitle: Test: Add TextUiTesting + Refactor startChat
commitResults.messageBody:
startChat function unable to print out to user the proper formatting
for mark/unmark task upon improper input formatting.

Let's
* Use a nested if else statement instead to check if the input after
mark/unmark command is an integer
* Add inputs in input.txt to test for all features of ToDos,
Deadlines, Events, List, Mark and Unmark, as well as to test if
exceptions for isInteger and handleCommand functions are executed
correctly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Style: Remove unnecessary lines in endChat function
Refactor code: Add command classes to improve code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
All commands are handled inside Beefy, causing code to be
unreadable as there are multiple levels of abstraction.

Adding multiple command classes help to distribute the code out into
multiple classes and improves readability.

Let's create an interface Command, and create commands for each of
the different command type to implement the interface.

commitResults.messageTitle: Style: Add/Remove blank lines
Merge branch 'branch-Level-5'
Package: Create beefy, command, parser, task and ui packages
Merge branch 'branch-A-Packages'
Refactor code: Change error handling
commitResults.messageBody:
Throw and catch statements with different exceptions are written in
the execute function in each individual command class, making it
hard to scale code in future.

Creating BeefyException class for all our execute functions and
class constructors to throw will allow for better scalability of
code in future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Feature: Add Delete functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's add deleteTask function in TaskList class, a switch statement
in Parser class to handle delete command, and a DeleteCommand class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Feature: Add Save functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's
* Create a Data folder to store all tasks added in a text file
(beefy.txt) in it
* Create a storage package with Storage class to handle all storage
functions such as converting beefy.txt into a TaskList, and updating
storage
* Modify TaskList.addTask function to not output anything during
initialization by adding a second Boolean variable initialize

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-6'
Merge branch 'branch-Level-7'
Feature: Implement save function after delete/mark/unmark task
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's call the function updateDisk in the execute function for the
respective command classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Bug Fix: Fix Storage class readDisk function
commitResults.messageBody:
Does not create directory to store storage text file when there is no
directory found, causing IO exceptions to occur upon writing to disk.

Creating a file when there is no directory found will prevent IO
exceptions from occurring.

Let's create a function that will be called to create the directory and
file when there is a FileNotFoundException.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code: Refactor Mark/Unmark task function
commitResults.messageBody:
Marking/unmarking tasks during initialization will cause output to be
printed.

Checking whether we are marking/unmarking task in initialization phase
before deciding on the need for output will solve the issue.

Let's create a Boolean variable isInitialize to check if the function is
called in the initialization stage.

commitResults.messageTitle: Style: Edit execute function in DeleteCommand class to follow K&R style
Feature: Make chatbot able to understand dates and times
commitResults.messageBody:
Chatbot can accept any string input for commands deadline and event.

Allowing chatbot to only accept a specific dateTime format for the
dateTime inputs will ensure proper deadline and event duration are
being stored. This ensures clean data storage.

Let's
* Refactor Deadline and Event class to store dateTime information in a
variable of type LocalDateTime
* Refactor DeadlineCommand and EventCommand constructors to throw an
exception when deadline's/event's dateTime information is not keyed in
using the proper dateTime format
* Refactor readDisk function in Storage class to parse dateTime
information stored in csv file into a LocalDateTime variable

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #1 from OKW32/branch-Level-8
commitResults.messageBody: Feature: Make chatbot able to understand dates and times

commitResults.messageTitle: Feature: Add Find functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's
* Create a Find Command class to handle the case when a find command is
to be executed
* Add a case statement to handle the find command in Parser class
* Add the function findTask in TaskList class to find all matching tasks
and print them out

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'master' into branch-Level-9
Merge pull request #2 from OKW32/branch-Level-9
commitResults.messageBody: Branch level 9

commitResults.messageTitle: Documentation: Add JavaDoc comments to all non-trival code
Merge branch 'master' into branch-A-JavaDoc
commitResults.messageBody:
# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/beefy/task/TaskList.java

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge pull request #3 from OKW32/branch-A-JavaDoc
commitResults.messageBody: Branch a java doc

commitResults.messageTitle: Add User Guide
Bug: Fix bug in message printing for marking and unmarking of tasks
commitResults.messageBody:
Printing of message occurs during the initialization phase instead
of chat phase.

Let's change the if condition in both markTask and unmarkTask
function from (isInitialize) to (!isInitialize).

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code: Refactor code for adding of deadline/event
commitResults.messageBody:
An empty task description can be added into the task list.

Making the code check if the task to be added has no description
will be able to ensure clean data storage.

Let's make the DeadlineCommand and EventCommand constructors throw
a BeefyException when an empty task description is passed into it.
